question: Question_04
statement:
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of the function
$\displaystyle f(x,y)=5+2x-x^2-4y^2$ on the rectangular region
$R = \{(x, y)\,|\,-1\leq x \leq 3, -1 \leq y \leq 1\}$.
hints:
First, find the critical points of $\displaystyle f$ (where
$\displaystyle f_x = f_y = 0$) in the interior of the domain, then check
the boundary. The extrema must be at one of the critical points, or on
the boundary.

To handle the boundary case, break up the boundary into 4
cases\[\displaystyle x = -1\], $\displaystyle x = 3$,
$\displaystyle y = -1$, and $\displaystyle y = 1$. For the first line,
you get a new function $\displaystyle g(y) = f(-1,y)$, which you can
then optimize subject to the constraint
$\displaystyle -1 \leq y \leq 1$. The other lines are similar.
